alert.note: Alert for Lee (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:27AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, central DeSoto, Tunica and Tate Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tunica, or 13 miles northeast of St Francis National Park, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Olive Branch, Hernando, Senatobia, Coldwater, Tunica, Barr, Phillipp, Strayhorn, Eudora, Dubbs, Independence, North Tunica, Lewisburg, Arkabutla, Robinsonville, Little Texas, Trinity, Cockrum and Savage. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
